Requires Python 2, not 3.

Requires Python 2, not 3.

V2.138 Update (Merged pull request #254 from m4rc1e/v2.138)
Bump version

updated requirements

Needed to update cu2qu dependency and its sub dependencies.

Previous version didn't reverse every glyph contour correctly,
https://github.com/googlei18n/cu2qu/blob/master/Lib/cu2qu/ufo.py#L169

Newer version will always reverse every contour.

Fix composite glyph flags, #251.

The dependency ufo2ft had a bug, https://github.com/googlei18n/ufo2ft/issues/136
which set the flags of composite glyphs incorrectly.

Solving the issue is rather complex. The previous implementation attempted to
convert cubic splines to quadratic twice, once in fonts_to_quadratic and again
in compileTTF. The conversion in compileTTF also reversed the contour
direction. The composite flags were getting set incorrectly in compileTTF's
conversion. To solve it, we disable conversion in compileTTF and enable the
reverse_direction parameter in fonts_to_quadratic.

Upgrading the ufo2ft dependency was not a viable option. The interfaces for
some of its sub dependencies has changed.
Bump version

Update tests.

Since the Condensed now has Medium weights, the font total has increased
from 18 to 20. The web fonts still have 18 because the Medium Condensed has
not been hinted. The Black weight webfonts also have their fsSelection and
fsType bits set back to Regular.

Do not set fsSelection bit or macStyle bit to Bold on Black styles.

@davelab6 has requested the webfonts have these bits set the Regular,
https://github.com/google/fonts/pull/710#issuecomment-288907945

This issue has been discussed in the past, #142, #188. There was no clear
answer. I'm implementing this change so the webfonts better conform to our
GF spec. This change will only affect the webfonts.
refactored chi swap
subset webfonts when running make (PR #238 from m4rc1e/web)

Update web tests

Removed TestFeatures.

This class tested whether c2sc, smcp and unic OT features worked. Since the
fonts have been subset, the post table has been set to version 3. This has
an effect on the glyph names.
https://www.microsoft.com/typography/otspec/post.htm

By changing the table to v3, the test failed because they relied on glyph
names stored in txt files, res/c2sc_requirements.txt...

The webfonts are derived from the out/RobotoCondensedTTF binaries. These
binaries have already had these OT features tested in
scripts/run_general_tests.py.
subset webfonts when running make

Overhaul CrOS post-processing

* Add touchup_for_cros.py
  - Update version (name table) and revision (OS/2)
  - Drop name table records other than for {pid=3,eid=1,langId=0x409}

* touch_up_web.py
  - apply_web_specific_fixes is split into 2 parts:
    apply_web_cros_common_fixes() and
    apply_web_specific_fixes()
  - Update version (name table) and revision (OS/2)

* temporary_touchups.py
  - Add an optional 'is_for_cros' to apply_tempoary_fixes.
    When is_for_cros is True, usWeightClass is set to 100 for Thin.
    Tthe latest release version of fontconfig on CrOS does not
    distinguish between Thin and Light when it's 250 for Thin.

* Makefile
  - Fix chromeos target

Part of #41
Add link to Google Fonts page to README.md
Remove old Windows build file.
[minor] Move "Setup" in README.md one level down.
Add general project description to README.md.
Bump up build number to 01289 to take a cut for Android.

Remove various hot fixes from touchup_for_android.py.

These are now fixed in the fonts themselves.

Merge pull request #36 from google/android

Add make target to build Android fonts from hinted fonts.
Remove extra zero from version number.
Bump up build number to 01288 to take a cut for Android.

Add make target to build Android fonts from hinted fonts.

The change is temporary, while we confirm the quality of our new
build toolchain. The target should go away once we switch completely
to the new toolchain.

This also removes the code that removed tab and unassigned characters
from the Android target, since the tab now has the same width as
space and the unassigned characters are no longer in the fonts.

Merge pull request #32 from google/vertical-metrics

Add tests for vertical metrics of individual glyphs.

Add tests for vertical metrics of individual glyphs.

The new tests check that every glyph fits in the [yMin, yMax] range.

Also switch run_general_tests.py to test the hinted fonts instead of
the unhinted fonts.

Remove Glass target.

No longer intended to be used.
Make the output of render.sh a little smaller.
Stop creating script-specific subsets for Google Fonts.
Add IPA samples from the Noto repostory.

Add tests and requirements for the 'smcp' feature.

Add tests for s-t and longs-t discretionary ligatures.
Test 'numr' and superscript digits to have the same width.
Add parameters to layout.py to pass down to HarfBuzz.

Make render.sh runnable from any directory.
Rename get_shapes to get_glyphs in layout.py.

Look at actual shapes instead of advances.

The previous code was mistakenly looking at advances of glyphs,
instead of the glyphs themselves.

Add test for soft-dotted characters.

The test is added to run_exhaustive_tests.py, and checks all
combinations of soft-dotted characters with combining marks above.

It's disabled for now, since the fonts fail it.
Add sample texts for soft-dotted characters.
Add several more sample texts based on internal bugs.

small capitals are added.
Whitespace cleanup in samples.
Add various sample text files.

Modify render.sh to display text in all font instances.

The input is also now read from a text file.

To see if github shows it as marked up text.

[minor] Make README.md fit in 80 columns.
Add completely hinted font deliveries from March 30.

No longer drop hints for ChromeOS.

Patch by Jungshik Shin. Fixes issue 128.

Add hinted font deliveries from February 27.

Roboto Light and Medium are added, with a redelivery of Regular and
Bold which has a fix for issue 119.

Update fonts from Paratype's Feb 10 delivery.

Regular, Bold, Italic, and Bold Italic fonts are updated.

Update hinted Black and Black Italic from Jan 15 delivery.

Nothing interesting to see here really, except for a usWeight hotfix
from 400 to 900 (issue 102) which is already hotpatched.  Updating to
just keep in sync with ParaType deliveries.

Fix name table overrides for condensed fonts.

Fixes issue 104 and issue 105.
Add tests for the bad hinting of lowercase 'o'.
Add FreeType python bindings to third_party.

Fix lowercase o in hinted Thin and Thin Italic fonts.

This is ParaType's delivery of January 13 and should fix issue 106.

Rename 'RobotoDraft' to 'Roboto' in the web target.

This is to finally create a replacement for the public Google Fonts
version of Roboto.
Update subsets for web.
Add more of common tests to run_web_tests.py.
Update build number for a new cut for Android.

Don't update font version in web target.

This is because web targets are from different cuts, and we want to
keep the information.
More moving web-specific tests and touchups to common.

Cleanup executable flags and #! headers.

Some files that were supposed to be executable didn't have the flag,
while others that were not supposed to be had #! headers.

Change copyright line of the fonts to 2011.

This is the year of the original release of Roboto.
More refactoring of touchup and test scripts.

Change the expected number of fonts for the web target.

The old value, 12, was for when we didn't have condensed yet.

Refactor tests to a reusable structure.

Tests that are common to some targets are not moved to
common_tests.py, with target-specific tests basically inheriting its
classes and modifying them.

The web tests are not refactored yet.
Remove TODO item from run_general_tests.py.
Move common and repeated tests to run_general_tests.py.

Add tests for version and revision numbers.

Also add a touchup to fix the revision number.

Move updating version numbers to temporar_touchups.

This is so that both Adroid and Web targets could reuse it.

Add test for non-formation of 'ff' ligature.

Also remove unused and tested touchups from the Android
touchup script.
Move get_advances to a new layout module.

Move the exhaustive tests to a different make targe.

Plus some cleanup in imports.

Move tests for spacing marks to general tests.

Also add test for font vendor ID in the OS/2 table and remove
no-longer-necessary touchups from touchup_for_android.py.

Update Android touchup and test tools for latest delivery.

Touchup:
- Shared touchups between Android and web are moved to a new module
- OS/2.usWeightClass is fixed to match the font name
- Unassigned characters are no longer explicitly dropped

Testing:
- Rhotic hook is skipped when checking that spacing marks don't form
  ligatures
- OS/2.usWeightClass is tested to be set correctly

Test for fsType being 0.

Also remove the code that touched it to be zero, since the value is
fixed in the fonts now.

Fixes issue 29.

Remove fix for macStyle from touchup_for_android.py.

And since the bug (issue 8) is fixed in the generated fonts now, add
test for macStyle to run_general_test.py.
Add hinted Roboto Condensed
Update to December 8 deliveries from ParaType.
Drop hints from the ChromeOS target (for now).
Add target for ChromeOS fonts.
Added out/web to .gitignore.

Add missing hints to the Light Italic font.

Four glyphs were missing hints. Fixes issue 100.
Comment out greek-ext subset.
Expand scripts for webfont generation.
Add targets and scripts for web fonts.
Add a character set for web fonts (from issue 69).
Added/updated hinted versions of Thin, Light, Medium, and Black.
Add hinted fonts received from ParaType in November.
Move test for lack of unassigned characters from Android to general tests.
Move TestDigitWidths from android tests to general tests.
Move test for sound copyright from Android-specific to general.
Add test for italic angle.
Update to ParaType deliveries of Oct 9, 2014.

Check for PUA characters in Android tests.

Fixes issue 5.
Make force_ymin_ymax script use internal font name in its reporting.
Add pointers to bugs discussing the hotfixes in touch_for_android.
Remove LICENSE for now.
Remove unassigned characters from the fonts' cmap.

Fix ccmp rules that used spacing marks instead of non-spacing ones.

Fixes https://b.corp.google.com/issue?id=16727859.

Make sure Unicode 8.0 characters are not asked for.

coverage_test.py didn't check that the characters is not post-Unicode 7.0.
Fix a dictionary mistakenly specificed as a set.

Add missing cmap entry for U+2117 SOUND RECORDING COPYRIGHT.

The cmap was missing in Thin and Thin Italic fonts, although the glyph
existed in the fonts.
Add scripts for testing minimal character coverage.
Updated build scripts based on July 28 deliveries from ParaType.
Add the Unicode coverage information for Roboto version 1.
Explain all third party modifications to fontcrunch.
Update .gitignore with more rules for fontcrunch and push up buildnumber.
Update android build rules to use crunched fonts as sources.
Make fontcrunch compilation work on older gcc.
Fix output path for 'make crunch'.
Add Makefile and .gitignore rules for fontcrunch.

Rename bezier curve pieces to .bez to avoid conflict with bzip files.

Also made Makefile clean temporary directories.
Get fontcrunch to run in the Roboto setup.
Add Spiro version 0.01.
Add fontcrunch to third_party.
Use the recommended way to access glyf table in force_ymin_ymax.

Add the beginning of a test infrastructure.

We now test for expected values of yMin and yMax, and equal widths for
digits.

Change the width of decimal digits to the same value.

Fixes issue 33, and the following external bugs:
https://code.google.com/p/android-developer-preview/issues/detail?id=330
https://b.corp.google.com/issue?id=16299966
Add out/android and out/glass to .gitignore
Refix the generating of lnum digits.
Merge branch 'master' of https://code.google.com/a/google.com/p/roboto
Update toolchain to latest ParaType delivery.
Minor fixes in wording and documentation for Glass touchup script.
Added a hack to add cmap mapping for proportional digit one.

Rework the font processing for Android.

yMin and yMax values needed for Android are now set after the subsetting in
a separate script.  The touchup script is also divided into Android-specific
changes and general ones.

Cleanup Android build mechanism and pass Android target through subsetter.

The touchup tool is now Android-specific and reads the data from the build
number file directly.  It also lists all glyph going outside the Android
boundaries.  Makefile also has a new 'android' target.

Revert TTFs to pre-touchup version.

Touch script to be modified for keeping its output separate.
Add LICENSE file.
Various cleanups needed for Android.

Update with extended character coverage for Unicode 7.0 LGC.

The scripts that generate the fonts are not updated yet.

Add script for post-production touch up of fonts

Also update to touched up Roboto and Roboto Condensed fonts.
Add hinted files from ParaType.
Make the build run on Windows.
Add ttx files and backup files to .gitignore
Fix linear numbers and small cap T with cedilla
Remove executable flags
Add .gitignore file
Removed vestigial code from v2 build script
Added a bold weight for Mono
Fixed inconsistent ymin and ymax values (for reals this time), removed old versions from 'out' directory.
Changed the ymax vertical metrics to match current version of Roboto
Importing Roboto 2.0
